page.title: 10BILLINGE MINES
page.content: The two drift mines in Billinge are both privately owned, they are called Castle Colliery and Quaker House Colliery. One of the differences between them is the age, Castle Colliery was opened 18 months ago in 1983, whereas Quaker House Colliery was opened 35 years ago in 1950. Another difference is the number of people employed by both mines.The Castle employs 21 people, Quaker House employ 55,which makes them bigger. Both mines have the men using old fashioned methods of mining i.e. using picks and shovels, so tend to employ older men who know how to do it. Quaker House has more mechanisation and tends to buy old stock and renovate it in their own workshop. The Quaker House Mine mines 5000 tonnes per year more than the Castle Mine.
